1115990958342955008.text: #zkSNARK proof generator in Web Assembly and parallelised with Web Workers.  A 50k constraint proof takes less than 10s to be generated from the browser. This new @identhree tool should be very useful in many zk-dApps https://www.reddit.com/r/ethereum/comments/bbmteb/websnark_zksnarks_generation_from_the_browser_is/ … @VitalikButerin @barrywhitehat @zooko

1104087785135312899.text: This is in largely due to @identhree for building a high level snark language that provides signatures and hash functions at a high level circomhttps://github.com/iden3/circom

1104087783658962944.text:
In 2018 I took me 3 months to make miximus an anonymous mixer. Last month at #ethdenver a team make the same in one weekend. The tools for building with snarks are getting better.  https://github.com/zdai-io/zDai-mixer …
.

1104087781964464128.text: Arguably the most interesting use case of s[nt]arks is no privacy but scalability. between 500 and 33000 tps depending upon data availability guarantees. No exit games, No state channels. https://hackmd.io/BKVuB2j4Sw2KcA8nWHGbrg?view …

1098486690757427200.text: Or we could create a universal login across multiple services while limiting the amount of overall requests you can make.

1098486688832200705.text: We can use this to create #tor #i2p networks which are spam/dos resistant. By requiring every participant to deposit a stake and then slashing them if they send more messages than they are allowed. The user remain anonymous if they follow the rules.

1098486687343226880.text: Whisper user proof of work to prevent spam. We could replace it with proof of stake using this approach.

1098486685753659392.text:
https://ethresear.ch/t/semaphore-rln-rate-limiting-nullifier-for-spam-prevention-in-anonymous-p2p-setting/5009 …

latest work allow stake and slashing to prevent spam while maintaining users anonymity

1028929845701427201.text:

elliptic curve point addition, ec point multiplication,  pedersen commitments and eddsa signature verification. All available in #ethereum's altbn128 (zksnark) curve.

1025574207256592384.text: Thanks to @feministPLT for her work and guidance on this. Based upon work by @hashbreaker , @hyperelliptic and many others...
